question.text: What is correct about the electron transport system?

options.text: Energy stored in ATPs is utilised for synthesis of NADH +  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>.</mo></math>

Energy stored in ATPs is utilised for synthesis of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> .

Energy stored in NADH + <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>.</mo></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is utilized for synthesis of ATPs.

Energy stored in glucose is utilized for synthesis of NADH + <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>, and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> only.

solution.text: Mechanism of ATP production: When the electrons pass from one electron carrier to another carrier (from complex I to IV) in ETS, they are coupled to ATP synthase (complex V) and thus ATP are synthesized.
